Smart Grid.Description: Smart Grids enable the integration of renewable energy sources into the electricity grid, allowing for a more sustainable and efficient energy system.

Smart Grids optimize the use of energy storage systems, such as batteries, to store excess electricity generated from renewable sources and release it when needed, improving grid reliability and stability.
Smart Grids support the charging infrastructure for electric vehicles, enabling efficient and controlled charging, as well as vehicle-to-grid integration for energy exchange between the grid and EVs.
Smart Grids utilize smart meters to monitor and manage energy consumption in real-time, providing consumers with detailed information and enabling demand response programs for load balancing.
